"All we can know is that we know nothing. And that's the height - f human wisdom." 
Everything within and around him seemed :on fused, senseless, and repellent. Yet in this very repugnance to all his circumstances Pierre found a kind of tantalizing satisfaction. 
"I make bold to ask your excellency to move \ little for this gentleman," said the postmaster, entering the room followed by another travel- er, also detained for lack of horses. 
The newcomer was a short, large-boned, yel- low-fa
